skill.name: code-review-digest-writer
skill.description: Generates weekly code-review digest docs from PR review comments for any GitHub repository. If present, follows project-specific docs/review-digests/AGENTS.md guidelines. Use this to turn a date-bounded set of PR reviews into a structured markdown ‚Äúnewsletter‚Äù that captures themes, repeated issues, and concrete takeaways.
skill.summary: Generates weekly code-review digest docs from PR review comments for any GitHub repository. If prese...
skill.author: DiversioTeam

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill that guides AI to generate markdown code review digests. It uses GitHub CLI (gh) to fetch PR data and writes structured documentation. No malicious patterns, obfuscation, or suspicious behaviors detected. Access is scoped to the documented docs/review-digests/ directory.

content.value_statement: Code review feedback is scattered across many PRs and hard to track. This skill transforms PR review comments into structured markdown newsletters that capture themes, repeated issues, and actionable best practices for your team.
actual_capabilities: Fetch PR review comments from GitHub using gh CLI for a date range
Cluster review feedback into themes (security, testing, performance, etc.)
Detect repeated issues across digests and tag as [NEW] or [REPEAT]
Write structured markdown digests to docs/review-digests/YYYY-MM-DD.md
Generate reference-style links to PRs and comments in digests
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) with authentication to fetch PR data
Limited to reading comments accessible via GitHub API
Only writes to docs/review-digests/ directory, cannot modify application code

use_cases.title: Track team learning
use_cases.description: Generate weekly digests to identify patterns in code review feedback and track team improvement over time.

use_cases.title: Document best practices
use_cases.description: Create persistent records of review themes to help onboard new team members to code standards.

use_cases.title: Monitor code quality trends
use_cases.description: Identify recurring issues across PRs to prioritize refactoring efforts and tooling improvements.

prompt_templates.title: Basic digest
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a code review digest for this repo from 2025-01-01 to 2025-01-07.

prompt_templates.title: With historical context
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR review digest for 2025-01-15 to 2025-01-29, using existing digests as historical context for detecting repeated issues.

prompt_templates.title: Cross-repo analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Summarize what reviewers focused on in owner/service-repo from 2025-02-01 to 2025-02-28 and highlight repeated issues.

prompt_templates.title: Themed newsletter
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a newsletter-style code review digest for this project from 2025-03-01 to 2025-03-15, tagging themes as [NEW] or [REPEAT] and marking [HIGH-IMPACT] items.

output_examples.input: Generate a code review digest for this repo from 2025-01-01 to 2025-01-14.
output: Overview: 4 PRs reviewed, 3 main themes identified
‚Ä¢ [NEW] Security: PII handling in API responses

best_practices: Provide a clear date range (YYYY-MM-DD ‚Üí YYYY-MM-DD) to scope the digest appropriately.
Check if your repo has docs/review-digests/AGENTS.md with project-specific guidelines.
Review past digests to maintain consistency in theme naming and tagging conventions.
anti_patterns: Using vague date ranges like 'last month' instead of specific start and end dates.
Skipping the docs/review-digests/ directory existence check before writing.
Running without gh CLI authentication, which limits access to PR review data.

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude Code, OpenAI Codex, and standard Claude. Installation varies by platform.

faq.question: What date format does the skill require?
faq.answer: Use ISO format YYYY-MM-DD for both start and end dates. Example: 2025-01-01 ‚Üí 2025-01-31.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my codebase?
faq.answer: No. The skill is restricted to reading and writing only in the docs/review-digests/ directory.

faq.question: Is my PR data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. Data stays local. The skill uses gh CLI to read GitHub data and writes markdown files to your repo.

faq.question: What if gh CLI is not installed?
faq.answer: The skill falls back to summarizing from local notes or existing digests, clearly noting incomplete data.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub insights?
faq.answer: This skill creates human-readable newsletters with themed analysis, repeated issue detection, and actionable takeaways.
